nodes.label: Witness saw suspect at scene
nodes.description: Multiple witnesses independently identified the suspect at the crime scene

nodes.label: DNA match found
nodes.description: DNA sample matches suspect with 99.9% certainty

nodes.label: Suspect's alibi is weak
nodes.description: The suspect's alibi has several inconsistencies and cannot be verified

nodes.label: Strong Evidence Combined
nodes.description: Both DNA and witness testimony together

nodes.label: Any Supporting Evidence
nodes.description: Either the combined evidence OR the weak alibi

nodes.label: Suspect is guilty
nodes.description: Based on the overwhelming evidence, the suspect committed the crime

nodes.label: Investigation Notes
nodes.description:
Key findings from the investigation:
- Crime occurred at 10:30 PM
- Suspect was seen nearby at 10:25 PM
- DNA found on murder weapon
- Suspect changed story twice

nodes.label: Analysis Method
nodes.description: This graph uses Bayesian reasoning to combine evidence. Each edge represents the strength of logical support between statements.

edges.rationale: Witness testimony is a strong input to the combined evidence
DNA evidence is extremely reliable input to the combined evidence
Strong combined evidence feeds into the overall case
Weak alibi provides additional support, even if not as strong
The combined logical evidence strongly supports guilt
Weak alibi provides some direct support, but not overwhelming
